11.23.19  7:55 pm   i'm not 11.22.19  8:55 pm , but kind of in the same situation. i have lost my creativity and ability to talk to people throughout the last year. feeling like my life is falling apart. i try to find joy in socializing again, or at least some sort of escape from reality. i really want to make other people happy, inspire them somehow, though i can't even help myself at the moment. would you kindly suggest something?
11.23.19  5:38 pm   11.23.19  11:12 am does this mean new bill wurtz content is still a long way off?

11.23.19  5:29 pm   11.22.19  7:17 pm   whoa no way! i have always heard that one as a waltz... just blew my own mind by listening to it in 12/8 (which was mostly successful with a conscious effort, i am pleased to report)

i think because the vocals so strongly imply a slower 3, i would have needed a 12/8 groove for a few bars before the verse, otherwise the count-in just gets recontextualised in my brain as "interesting weird rhythm"

      having said that i just tested it on my sister and she got the 12/8 straight away so maybe my brain is just weird. this makes me want to do a survey

11.23.19  3:40 pm   11.22.19  12:27 pm My solutions to problems are always straight lines from problem to solution. I can only see my straight line and seem to be blind to all the wiggly lines that appear plain to see for others. How do I see these other lines?

11.23.19  12:56 am   11.22.19  1:06 pm you can use cycles on AMD gpus using openCL (almost on par with cuda) if you're willing to hop on over into windows or linux.

      unfortunately opencl cycles rendering on AMD gpus is not supported in MacOS for some reason

11.23.19  12:24 am   11.22.19  12:09 pm This isn't a question, but I'm using Chrome in Chrome OS and the the short page works a lot better. The whole thing loads instantly and without complaint. On the full page, it loads maybe 3% of the way (up to "incognito mode") and then chugs along slower than I read, with occasional freezing. The other browsers I tested (Firefox and NetSurf, both on Ubuntu, running on the same device) were able to handle either page just fine, although the full page took maybe a second longer.

11.16.19  10:00 pm   11.16.19  10:21 am it's better now, but still lagging, unfortunately. from my testing, if i create a blank file with 3000 lines of identical text it works fine, at 4000 it starts to misbehave (it seems to have more to do with the number of lines of text than the page height)

to be clear, this is not an issue with your website, this is an issue with google chrome for android. even edge for android (which uses the same exact browser engine) doesn't have this issue. i will see if i can notify google

11.16.19  10:21 am   11.15.19  12:53 am not the asker but chrome for android has a weird bug where this page scrolls really slowly, at like 2fps. if you select a link (by long pressing on it) the bug magically fixes itself. alternatively, switching to firefox fixes it

11.9.19  7:51 am   11.8.19  3:47 pm
if im willing to put in 5 years to learn 3 or 4 instruments,

      and the level of good i want to get is about to the level where if i started busking people would hear me and they would say something like "wow youre really really good" and then they give 20 dollars. and that repeats with lots or people that walk by. though i think tou might need some more factors to understand if i should pursue music, such as my singing voice. my singing voice is naturally pretty good (for reference it sounds very similar to your voice, but when singing it sounds different to the point where its unique) my voice is suited for more rock and pop type somgs, but i could also try hip hop type songs, but my voice can not do the growling thing that tends to happen in metal songs. i have a keyboard with 61 keys, (though im poor so its not very good) i hope to learn simple songs, and then everything necassa ry for m y journey to success. i know a bit about basic music theory but i dont know how to put it down and do things, and i dont have the muscle memory to always hit the notes im trying to on triads, because i havent even done any real practice. i cant afford lessons right now. i can picture myself being successful to exactlty the degree i want, but i dont know how to get there, or where to start my journey. i havent been involved with music from a young age. my confidence level is about 60%, but when i get my journey started it will definitely be atleast 90%. based on all these factors would it be a good idea to pursue music?

      sorry for writing a very long question, i just had so many things i wanted to say.
thank you
